metadata.subject: Top 10 US Ideas Quarterly - Q1 2017
metadata.sender: Anthony Cassamassino, Derek Harris (BofA Merrill Lynch)

relationships.description: BofA Merrill Lynch provides research coverage and investment recommendations for the companies listed
Republican control expected to benefit defense spending and companies like General Dynamics
Expected pro-energy agenda from incoming administration benefiting energy companies like Hess

assets: Various company stocks with market capitalizations ranging from $8.6B to $73.9B

analysis.purpose: To provide investment recommendations for Q1 2017 based on analysis of market conditions and company catalysts
analysis.significance: Shows institutional investment thinking immediately following Trump election victory and Republican sweep of Congress

concerns: Investment banking relationships with covered companies

notable_quotes: The backdrop for risk assets has changed dramatically over the past year. We experienced a historic US Presidential election and Republican sweep of Congress on November 9th.
Our current strategy stands in stark contrast to our stance last year of looking for defensive growth ideas.
red_flags: Potential conflicts of interest with investment banking relationships
Heavy reliance on political outcomes for investment thesis

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail, coercion, or pressure tactics found in this investment research report

illegal_activity.description: This is a legitimate investment research report with no indication of illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: Investment research reports from major banks are typically distributed to clients but may become public. This analysis of post-election market strategy would be of interest to financial media.

analysis.summary: BofA Merrill Lynch's Q1 2017 Top 10 US Ideas report provides investment recommendations favoring companies expected to benefit from Republican policy changes, including fiscal stimulus, deregulation, and tax reform. The report includes eight Buy recommendations and two Underperform recommendations across various sectors, with particular emphasis on defense, energy, and financial companies.
